author: Matt Huertas
comment: Had to reinstall because of the 5.1 update and now can't log in at all, even with the official Swarm app installed. Need to fix the OAuth link or else people will never be able to install this as a new app.

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: Hello Matt, I'm sorry this happened. It should be already fixed. Thank you for the report and please let me know in case of any further complications.

author: Maxime PINCHON
comment: Really good app for swarm users like me, but it could be improved: when we are in a place with a high density of places, downtown for instance, it is rare I find the place I actually am. So I have to check-in from my phone and I loose the interest of the app. So two ways of improving it: maybe configure from the phone the number of places we want to see., And even more powerful: add vocal search in the watch app :) Good job anyway, I use it every day !
title: Good app, but not enough places displayed

author: Christopher Martinez
comment: This app is everything I was looking for when using my Moto360.  This makes checking in less of a task now and makes me want to use my foursquare account a lot more!  I really recommend getting this app if you have a android wear device and use swarm.
title: AMAZING APP!

author: Marius
comment: The app should sort the venues list on the watch by the amounts of own check ins in the past. By that, once could easily access regular venues.
title: Sort according to most check ins

author: Christopher Barraud
comment: No longer functions on LGWR since update.

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: Hello Christopher, I'm sorry this happened. It should be already fixed. Thank you for the report and please let me know in case of any further complications.

title: Broken since wear update

author: RJ McKenzie
comment: Great app but it needs the option to post to twitter as well when you check in.
title: Twitter posting?

author: denise knox
comment: Junk not working anymore
title: Not working

comment: Working great, but lacks option to check in somebody besides you.
title: Great!

author: Brad Meyer
comment: Moto 360 issue fixed!

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: It should be fixed in 1.14 release.

title: Great functionality but...

author: Don Joslyn
comment: Awesome

author: Rik Miller
comment: This app used to work great but now all I get is check in failed using a moto X 2014 paired with a g watch. Please fix for higher rating.

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: It should be fixed in 1.14 release.

title: Check in failed every time now

author: Rubén Salas
comment: Thank you for adding the social medial to this sweet app , but can we have the option to turn off social media while checking in. Sometimes I want to post FB and Twitter sometimes I don't.

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: Hey Rubén. Thank you for your feedback! Currently I'm working on more convenient solution, how to make a check-in with social networks.

title: A must for 360 users, great app, but ...

author: Teddy St.N
comment: works great on my SW3
title: sweet

comment: After UI change for 360, it seems square watch users got thrown under the bus.  I still can't check into "private" venues (like homes).  It would also be nice if the location icons were cached, as it seems they are loaded every time I see a specific place type. Fix it please.

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: It should be fixed in 1.14 release. It seems private venues aren't supported in Foursquare public API. Let me know if you find anything else.

title: LG G Watch

author: Russel Corbo
comment: Followed instructions and continues to fail

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: It should be fixed in 1.14 release.

title: Fails check in on moto360

author: Ákos Maróy
comment: I've downloaded the app, and at first it worked fine, I could check into a location via the app.  then I went to a different location, and wanted to check in, but the location list would not update, no matter what I'm doing

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: Hello Ákos, I've fixed this in new version - 1.12.

title: place list doesn't update :(

author: Andrew Colombani
comment: Checks in fine, but needs options to leave comments on checkins as well as tagging friends and adding stickers.
title: Good, but needs options...

author: Jaxon Wright
comment: I suggested a feature to the developer, and they added it in a few days
title: Great app

author: Wilhelm Fitzpatrick
comment: I really like having this app, because I was getting used to being able to check in on Foursquare via my Pebble, so this lets me keep rolling with that. The developer has been responsive, and improving when the app posts new cards to the notification stack so it is not as intrusive as it was at first.
title: Developing well

author: Ray-Allen Taylor
comment: would be much better if it wouldn't be so talkative. I really don't need to know what's going around me every 15 minutes when I'm sitting in my office.... Location change awareness would be nice. And it would be nice to see places I have checked in previously at the top if the list... Including privat places (like for me my home.... So I can check in and my flatmates know I am home... I still need to do that with my phone...)

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: Thank you for feedback. I plan to add option to completely disable automatic notifications. For now you can increase location update interval. UPDATE: In 1.05 I've added option to completely disable automatic notifications. Let me know how it works for you.

title: Ok

author: Michael Spick
comment: App works as described. The settings for only notifying if you've moved a certain distance are a nice fix from the previous version. Next up, auto share checking to Facebook and It will be exactly what I'm looking for!
title: Perfect way to check in!

author: Chris Carella
comment: This is a good start but , still a bit too aggressive on the cards. I look forward to a future update that is less aggressive. I'm excited about this app and with some tweaks, I think it would be one of my most heavily used AndroidWear apps.  Some feedback:  - If I dismiss the notifications from the watch or phone, I don't want to see it again in that location.  - I don't want to see them while I'm walking (which is happening frequently during my 20-30 min walks in NYC)  - If I've checked in, using this app or the official SWARM app, I don't want to see cards while I'm at that location.  - I mostly want to see it when I have arrived at a new place.

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: Hi, this should be fixed in new release - 1.02. Please check it out and let me know ;)

title: Almost there

author: Sterling Bourne
comment: If I could change one thing it would be the frequency the card appears on my watch. Ideally, it'd only show up after I've been moving/driving and reach my destination and/or every 4-6 hours.  Edit: Read your response. Might I suggest as a work-around... after the user checks in somewhere, mute notifications sent to the watch for at least an hour. I rarely find I check into multiple places in that timeframe. Or perhaps add it as a user defined option... "Mute notifications for X hours after most recent check-in."

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: Thank you for feedback! Idea of movement detection makes sense, but it could be tricky to find optimal minimal distance for showing notification. User can move to place right next to another one. But I'll experiment with it later. When it comes to activity recognition(like driving)it could lead to battery draining-I'd have to detect it all the time

title: Wonderful Android Wear App

author: Tim Jenkins
comment: Not really sure the point in this I seem to have to open the app on my phone in order to check in.   Doesn't have a check in option on  the watch
title: Can't check in on watch.

author: Alexander Beckx
comment: I hope that in the future you can choose that it will also post it directly to Twitter or Facebook if you would check in.

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: Thanks for feedback! I'll add it into backlog ;)

title: Post directly to Twitter?

author: Erie T
comment: Need ability to search for places directly from the watch then check in. At this point, have to launch the app then it'll show places on watch.

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: Hi, thanks for feedback. I've added this feature in version 1.03 ;)

title: Ok

author: Muhammad Farizartracingg
comment: Good job

author: Shaun Mook
comment: Annoying alerts are always popping up on the phone even when you tick the box to have them on the watch too. Strangely nothing ever pops up on the watch and you have to manually launch app

author: Nick Hester
comment: Seems to constantly want to check in when it is least convenient

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: You can set you own minimum update interval and you can also disable showing of notification on your phone ;) Let me know, how it works for you.

title: Notification Spammy

author: Joe Katon
comment: I think this app is a great start. However, BeeWear app is by far a much better app with a significant amount of control on sensitivity, proximity and more controlled card notifications.
title: Not enough logic

comment: Worked literally once.

reply.author: GENERIFY.IO
reply.content: It should be fixed in 1.14 release.
